intro: Typha elata, commonly known as the narrow leaf cattail, is a perennial wetland plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical flower heads that mature into brown, fluffy structures. The plant has long, narrow leaves that grow in dense clusters around a central stem. It thrives in shallow water or moist soils, often found in marshes, ponds, and along the edges of lakes. Typha elata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
